meanings.definition: To surpass in firepower or shooting ability.
meanings.sent1: The new tank design easily outguns the old models.
meanings.sent2: In the battle, the enemy's artillery outguns ours.
meanings.sent3: The water gun outguns the squirt bottle in our playful fight.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed outguns any obstacles in his way.
meanings.sent5: The sun outguns all other stars in brightness.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outdo in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: Her team outguns all others in the basketball tournament.
meanings.sent2: The underdog surprisingly outguns the reigning champion.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outguns the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His wit outguns his opponents in every debate.
meanings.sent5: The storm outguns any previous ones we've experienced.
